subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Woody Austin made a 35-foot birdie putt on the 18th hole to win the Merrill Lynch Shootout with his teammate Mark Calcavecchia in Naples, Fla. The two won by a shot over the tournament host, Greg Norman, and Bubba Watson.The putt gave the team a final-round nine-under-par 63 in the scramble format and a 29-under 187 total.Norman and Watson barely missed birdie tries from 25 feet after Austin made his putt. Norman’s ball ended up inches right of the hole, and Watson’s putt faded and broke in front of the hole to the left.Norman was trying to win for the first time since the 2001 Skins Game. Watson has not won as a professional.
